documents.s: Vision: The Universal Code Context Engine

documents.t: Code Confluence is currently in alpha stage of development. During this phase, we are not accepting direct code contributions as the core architecture and features are still being actively developed and may undergo significant changes.
While we're not accepting code contributions at this time, there are still valuable ways you can help improve Code Confluence:

If you encounter any bugs or issues: Check if the issue has already been reported in our GitHub issues If not, create a new issue following our bug report template Provide detailed steps to reproduce the issue Include relevant information about your environment Add screenshots if applicable

Have ideas for new features or improvements? Check our existing issues and feature requests first Create a new issue. Clearly describe the feature and its use cases Explain how it would benefit the project and its users We appreciate your interest in Code Confluence and look forward to your feedback as we continue to develop the project!

Code Confluence RoadmapAchieving Comprehensive Code ConfluenceIntegration SDKDevelop SDK for knowledge engine integration.Automated DocumentationSummarize and visualize documentation automatically.Knowledge GraphEmbed code sections into a queryable knowledge graph.Graph-Based RepresentationDefine a robust graph schema for Domain-driven representation and ingest into Graph Database.Codebase ParsingUtilize Tree-Sitter and ANTLR for precise codebase parsing. Our roadmap outlines the key milestones in achieving comprehensive code confluence: Codebase Parsing (Beta) üöß In Progress Utilize Tree-Sitter and ANTLR for precise codebase parsing. Currently in beta testing phase. Domain Driven Graph-Based Representation (Beta) üöß In Progress Define a robust graph schema for domain-driven representation of codebase with all its data and metadata and ingest into compatible graph database. Knowledge Graph Embed code sections into a queryable knowledge graph Automated Documentation Summarize and visualize documentation automatically Integration SDK Develop SDK for knowledge engine integration

Welcome to Unoplat Code Confluence - Your Gateway to Code Understanding! Current Status üîÑ Unoplat Code Confluence currently supports Python codebases and is in alpha stage. We're actively working on expanding language support and features. While in alpha stage, it's best suited for developers and tech enthusiasts who enjoy exploring new tools, don't mind a few rough edges, and are willing to provide feedback as we work towards establishing a complete end-to-end workflow!
The current version supports parsing codebases and exporting a JSON representation of code graph. For more details, check out: üìò Vision ¬ª
Before you begin, ensure you have the following tool installed: Tool Purpose üê≥ Docker & Docker Compose ¬ª For running services

Follow these steps to set up Code Confluence: Create Project Directory and Download Configuration: mkdir -p code-confluence && cd code-confluence # Download Docker Compose file curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/unoplat/unoplat-code-confluence/refs/heads/main/prod-docker-compose.yml Launch Services: docker compose -f prod-docker-compose.yml up -d Verify Deployment: docker compose -f prod-docker-compose.yml ps
Open your browser and go to http://localhost:3000

When prompted, enter a GitHub PAT with read access to the repositories you want to ingest. This is required for Code Confluence to clone and analyze your repositories. Getting a GitHub PAT If you don't have a GitHub PAT: Go to GitHub Settings ‚Üí Developer Settings ‚Üí Personal Access Tokens ‚Üí Tokens (classic) Click "Generate new token (classic)" Give it a name like "CodeConfluence" Select only the repo scope (this gives read access to repositories) Click "Generate token" and copy it You only need read access since we'll just be cloning repositories!
documents.s: 2. Enter Your GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT)

documents.t: Press s or S (Shift + s) to open the search dialog. You can search through your personal, public, and open source repositories.
In the Actions column, click on Ingest Repo for the repository you want to analyze.

A Repository Dialog Configuration will open up where you can add one or more codebases for that repo. For each codebase, fill in the following: Root Package: Path to root package/module where the main file for the codebase is situated Codebase Folder: Folder for codebase within the mono repo (check "No subdirectory" if codebase lives in the repository root) Package Manager: Select the package manager Programming Language: Currently only Python is supported Example: Configuring CrewAI‚Äã For example, to ingest the popular agent framework CrewAI: Once done, click Submit to start the ingestion process.

Navigate to Settings > Developer Mode, and toggle the switch on to unlock infrastructure tooling. Once enabled, you will see two new tools: Workflow Orchestrator‚Äã Access and manage automated workflows View execution logs and debug orchestration issues Monitor real-time workflow performance Click the "Workflow Orchestrator" button to open the temporal workflow orchestrator dashboard. Knowledge Graph‚Äã Explore the knowledge graph, inspect entities and relationships, and debug data connections Click the "Knowledge Graph" button to open the Neo4j Browser directly When Neo4j Browser opens, you'll be prompted to log in with: Username: neo4j Password: password Once logged in, try this query to explore your code graph: MATCH (n) RETURN n LIMIT 25 tip The above query displays the first 25 nodes in your code graph, perfect for a quick overview!
Need assistance? We're here to help!

GitHub Issues üìù Visit GitHub Issues ¬ª to: Report bugs or request features Browse existing solutions Get developer support Community Support üí¨ Join our Discord Community ¬ª to: Connect with other users Get real-time assistance note Remember to check existing issues before creating a new one! This documentation is powered by Docusaurus, making it easy to maintain and extend.

Code Confluence VisionThe graph is made queryable for usersCodebase DumpKnowledge Graph CreationQueryable Graph DevelopmentAutomatic DocumentationUser InteractionIntegration Partner UseInitial codebase is ingested into the systemCode elements are organized into a structured graphDocumentation is generated automatically from the graphDevelopers and architects interact with the systemIntegration partners utilize the system for their needs
documents.s: Vision: The Universal Code Context Engine

documents.t: Unoplat Code Confluence aims to be the definitive solution for extracting, understanding, and providing precise code context across repositories and domains. We believe that combining deterministic code grammar with state-of-the-art LLM pipelines can achieve human-like understanding of codebases in minutes rather than months.

Precision First Built for deterministic and accurate code context extraction Leverages Antlr and tree-sitter grammars for reliable parsing Ensures accuracy in code relationship mapping AI-Powered Understanding Advanced LLM pipelines that comprehend code relationships Semantic understanding similar to human developers Based on in-house graph structures and parsing algorithms Graph Intelligence Uses graph databases for both ingestion and querying Enables deep contextual understanding Preserves complex relationships between code elements Enterprise-Grade Reliability Powered by workflow orchestration Scalable and reliable processing Production-ready architecture

Unoplat Code Confluence provides: High-precision code context API powered by graph-based retrieval Cross-repository semantic understanding through LLM pipelines Reduced operational complexity for context extraction Ready-to-use integration with popular tools like OpenDevin, Devon, Danswer, and Continue Dev

We are committed to: Expanding language support beyond Python Enhancing our LLM pipelines for even better code understanding Building more integration points with popular development tools Developing advanced visualization and analysis capabilities Our vision is to make codebases more accessible, understandable, and maintainable for developers worldwide, whether they're working on small projects or enterprise-scale systems. Ready to get started? Check out our Quick Start Guide to begin your journey with Unoplat Code Confluence.
